features.name: Slayer Proficiencies
features.desc: A slayer is proficient with all simple and {g|Encyclopedia:Weapon_Proficiency}martial weapons{/g}, as well as with light armor, medium armor, and shields (except tower shields).

features.name: Studied Target
features.desc:
A character can study an opponent he can see as a {g|Encyclopedia:Move_Action}move action{/g}. The character then gains a +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} against it. The {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}save{/g} DCs of character class abilities against that opponent increase by 1.
If a character deals sneak attack damage to a target, he studies that target, allowing him to apply his studied target bonuses against that target (including to the normal weapon damage {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}roll{/g}).
At 5th, 10th, 15th, and 20th levels, the bonuses on weapon attack rolls, damage rolls and to character save DCs against a studied target increase by 1.
At 7th level, a character can study an opponent as a move or {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}.

features.name: Slayer Talents
features.desc:
As a slayer gains {g|Encyclopedia:XP}experience{/g}, he learns a number of talents that aid him and confound his foes. Starting at 2nd level and every 2 levels thereafter, a slayer gains one slayer talent.
Slayer can take rogue talents as slayer talents, counting his slayer level as rogue level.
After 2nd level, the slayer can select a ranger combat style (such as archery or two-weapon combat) and gains a combat {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} from the first feat list of that style. He can choose feats from his selected combat style, even if he does not have the normal prerequisites. After 6th level, he may select this talent again and add the 6th-level ranger combat feats from his chosen style to the list. After 10th level, he may select this talent again and add the 10th-level ranger combat feats from his chosen style to the list.

features.name: Sneak Attack
features.desc:
If a character can catch an opponent when he is unable to defend himself effectively from her {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}, she can strike a vital spot for extra {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}.
The character's attack deals extra damage anytime her target would be denied a {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} (whether the target actually has a Dexterity bonus or not), or when the character {g|Encyclopedia:Flanking}flanks{/g} her target. This extra damage is {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} and increases by 1d6 at later levels. This additional damage is precision damage and is not multiplied on a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g}.
The character must be able to see the target well enough to pick out a vital spot and must be able to {g|Encyclopedia:Reach}reach{/g} such a spot.

features.name: Advanced Talents
features.desc: After 10th level, a character can choose one of the advanced rogue talents in place of a rogue talent.

features.name: Slayer's Advance
features.desc: At 13th level, a slayer can once per day increase his movement {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} by 30 ft, and his movement doesn't provoke {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attacks of opportunity{/g}. At 17th level, he can do this twice per day.

features.name: Quarry
features.desc: A character can, as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, denote one target within his line of sight as his quarry. He receives a +2 insight {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} made against his quarry, and all {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical{/g} threats are automatically confirmed. A character can have no more than one quarry at a time.

features.name: Slayer's Advance
features.desc: At 13th level, a slayer can once per day increase his movement {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} by 30 ft, and his movement doesn't provoke {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attacks of opportunity{/g}. At 17th level, he can do this twice per day.

features.name: Improved Quarry
features.desc: At 19th level, the character's ability to hunt his quarry improves. He can now select a quarry as a {g|Encyclopedia:Free_Action}free action{/g} and his insight {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} his quarry increases to +4.

features.name: Master Slayer
features.desc: At 20th level, the slayer becomes a master at capturing or killing his studied targets. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, he can make a single {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} against a studied target at his full attack {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g}. If the attack succeeds, the target takes {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} normally and must succeed at a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude saving throw{/g} or die. The {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} for this save is 10 + 1/2 the slayer's level + the slayer's {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier. Whether or not the target succeeds, it cannot be targeted by this ability again (by any slayer) for 24 hours.
